Reviews.Title: “I SUGGEST IT TO EVERYONE”
Reviews.Author: aisha O
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and the service was amazing. They suggested us so many trendy and historical places, thanks to the people there we have seen places that many of my friends did not. Also the rooms were incredibly comfortable. I loved the hotel and my time in Istanbul. THANKS TO SHOE TURKISH HOSPITALITY TO US and keep that amazing terrace;)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Return”
Reviews.Author: GROW756
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel in the past but this time we were disappointed by the service and room. This is our third stay at this hotel but we will not return in the future. The internet did not work well, the room was very small and in a location that we had no window, it was noisy and the front desk unresponsive to our concerns. The hotel management must have changed si nce our last stay. It is an excellent location thus we regret the present situation, hopefully they will correct somf of the issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great price / quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: MarkWijman
Reviews.Content: Location and offerings are hard to beat at this price level â€“ comfortable rooms, nice breakfast offerings and a few steps from the Blue Mosque. Friendly staff that goes out of their way.

Reviews.Title: “the great amiral”
Reviews.Author: Waad M
Reviews.Content: The location was great for exploring the Grand Bazaar, Spice market and Sultahmet. The room was delightful, decorated with style and charm, and made to feel like a home away from home. Staff typical of turkish hospitality they went above and beyond in assisting me and my family with suggesting sites and tours. Free internet is available for guests. I had a great time and would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Hist0ricTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amiral Palace for 5 days last year in November for our Honeymoon. It was an excellent experience, staff were curteous and helpful. Our room was a corner room with a beautiful rounded window with a sitting area. The room was very clean with all the necessary amenties. The breakfast was good, we filled ourselves on yogurt and various meats, but definately save room for a Simit from a street vendor! In terms of location, Amiral is ideally located. Sultanhamet is a bustling neighborhood and some of the hotels which are on the main street could potentially be noisey - but the Amiral is set slighly off the main "Hotel Row" by one block and I found that it was much more serene. Sites around Sultanhamet are easily within walking distance, Hagia Sofia is about 7 minutes, Blue Mosque is the same, Topkapi is about 15 minutes, Basilica Cistern is about 10. We even walked all the way to the Galata Tower, over the Galata Bridge and that took about an hour and 25 minutes. Best Walk Ever, you see so much culture when you walk instead of taking a taxi! My tip on restaurants: Avoid the restaurants that are nearest to the hotel, instead walk further out, past Sultanhamet Park and there are some restaurants on the road towards Topkapi and Gulyhane Park that are cheaper and really good. We ate at a restaurant twice that I believe was called Turkish BBQ. Cheap Prices and excellent Pide's and beer. Also, we at mostly street food during the day and never got sick or had problems. Sandwiches from the street vendors run you about fifty cents (US) and are great! I would highly recommend staying at this hotel and hope to someday visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, central location”
Reviews.Author: Terri M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of six and enjoyed the hotel very much. Staff was courteous and the location was great. The breakfast gets a little redundant after three days. Most sites within walking distance in the Sutanahmet area. I recomment this place to anyone visitiing this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Lily0008
Reviews.Content: great location in a lively corner in Sultanahmet; many mosques in walking distance also some bazaars; however, the hotel is a nice size, clean and neat; with excellent service and very friendly staff; wifi across the whole house; excellent! would go back at any time

Reviews.Title: “Amiral Palace: Clean and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Linda K
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks at Amiral Palace and was impressed the whole time. The hotel is clean and the staff are courteous and friendly. My friend and I could walk to most of the locations in the Sultenhamet area of Old Town. Breakfast was part of the hotel fee, but complimentary tea was often served to us in the evening. I plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: muffin00
Reviews.Content: Spacious room with comfortable bed, pleasant staff who smiled and were keen to help, great complimentary afternoon tea and drinks during the day, good breakfast choice, good value. Nice terrace with view though it was a bit cold to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: joelwx39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the beginning and end of our tour of Turkey. The location is nice. Just below the Blue Mosque. You can see that from the rooftop dining area. That is a nice place to sit on the evening. Just a block away from a street full of restaurants. Walking distance from the Sultanahmet tram station. Front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. They called many times to the airport checking on my lost luggage.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay at the Amiral Palace”
Reviews.Author: Theresa F
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Istanbul, and we had an unforgettable and pleasing experience.The hotel is located in a very nice area, close to all major sites, many restaurants and shops are all around the area. The hotel staff is warm and welcoming , they treated us like family. The staff attended to every question and need, given us a family oriented hospitality. We will return very soon. We highly recommend the Amiral Palace. Three Friends From NY

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location/charming”
Reviews.Author: heyjude1901
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of a minibus tour. The hotel was chosen by the tour company---Neon tours---excellent company. The room, although fine, overlooked the dining room with appropriate but weird screenings between. I would not recommend staying on this floor. No view and it's hard to figure out lwhere you are when you first walk in. It was quite charming decor and my shower was great. I would like to recommend that hotels think about installing grab bars in the showers. I have a slight walking problem and would have appreciated that security. Also re above, the dining area is stairs up from the buffet breakfast in a not so charming patio. Would be better to have the food upstairs. The breakfast was perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “location is good”
Reviews.Author: jadir11
Reviews.Content: the room was ok and clean ,location was ok ,frontdesk people were helpful espicaily that lady . breakfast location sucks ,Ants all over it ,staff were rude .....

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Makoto
Reviews.Content: My son and I just returned from an 11 day trip to Istanbul. In the middle of the trip, we traveled to Izmir for two nights, then returned to Istanbul for the remainder of the trip. So we stayed at the Amiral Palace hotel in two different rooms. I'd like to offer my impressions and comment on some of the issues raised in other reviews. Having stayed at 2 different hotels, I think the breakfast at Amiral is comparable to the normal Turkish hotel breakfast. Having said that though, I do agree that it gets kind of old if you stay there for more than a couple of days. Trouble is, I was never able to find a really good hearty Turkish breakfast at a close restaurant. I heard the dog barking, but I think it was chained up at a property next door to the hotel. It didnâ€™t really bother me all that much. The first night I stayed at the hotel there was a party on the rooftop terrace across the street until about 1 am. Other than that 1 night, it was fairly quiet. The location is good but not great. You are about a 5 - 10 min walk up hill to the major attractions of old town, but you have to go through a gauntlet of restaurant hawkers to get there. I think it would be better to be a little farther up the hill and closer to the Tram. The rooms are OKâ€”I would call them adequate. Yes, the tubs drain very slowly, but that was the case in both rooms I stayed in. I think this is a common issue around here. On the second visit, the AC would not come on and there was no phone in the room. I reported it to the staff in the morning on the way out. When I returned, the AC/Heating unit was on, but it was turned to heat. The air was not cold. Since it was not all that hot at night, I just blew it off and opened the window. I think the staff are nice enough, but not forth coming. When I arrived, I said that I was going to take the ferry to Bandirma to catch a train to Izmir (see http://www.seat61.com/Turkey2.htm#Istanbul to Izmir). No one at the hotel knew of this option of traveling to Izmir. However, they did know of the ferry to Bandirma. It would have been nice for someone to suggest that I get the tickets in advance because these ferries fill up quickly. Unfortunately, I didnâ€™t get the tickets in advance and had to make an expensive last minute flight to Izmir. When I made the reservation, I asked for a pick up and return to the airport. I was given instructions for the pickup for my initial arrival, but I was never told that I would have to pay for my return to the airport. I found this failure to state that the hotel would provide only a pick up shuttle to be a deliberate non-disclosure. My advice is to avoid assumptions and get everything explicitly in writing. I think all in all this is probably a fairly typical hotel in the Sultanahmet area. I think I may have been able to find a better value, but this one was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ahatrack
Reviews.Content: At a glance, Amiral Palace is a decent hotel in a very convenient location (just minutes from Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia). Though quite expensive, it's clean, relatively comfortable and has almost everything you need. It also comes with a free breakfast. If that is good enough for you, stop reading the review here. My issues with Amiral Palace runs deeper. While I enjoyed my stay, it was far from perfect. To start, there was no clock in the room. The TV was also broken (not that we wanted to watch, but still), the in-room mini bar was NEVER restocked (even when we called the front desk to ask for more bottles of water). The showers were cramped (and clogged) and completely messy (impossible not to soak the floor). The free breakfast was barely edible. To add to the annoying inconveniences, there is also a dog tied up in the hotel's courtyard (which more accurately resembles a garbage pit) that barks tirelessly through the night. It's no wonder: the poor thing never seems to be taken off its two-foot-chain (even on really hot days when its only shelter is a patio chair). Heart breaking. Anyway, I digress. On the surface, Amiral Palace seems like a decent place but we found it to be quite a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: hishamabdelnour
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to Sultan Ahmed with lots of touristic sites and full of restaurants and souvenir and crafts shops easily found around the area. Hotel staff are very helpful and ready for their clients. Breakfast was served on their terrace; very basic with no varieties, scrambled eggs cold, juice is non- natural type...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean rooms, but not treated well by staff.”
Reviews.Author: BJ7069
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations a month in advance, and checked with the hotel the night before our stay. We had confirmed reservations using a credit card, but when we checked in they had given our room away, saying the credit card was invalid. This wasn't true and we were very angry. They ignored our concerns, but sent us to another hotel down the street & would give us a reduced price on it and the next 2 nights our room would be available at Amiral Palace for a reduced price. The other hotel was not as nice, but we returned to the Amiral & room was very nice, quiet, & clean. Breakfast was a large buffet, but food not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really friendly reception staff”
Reviews.Author: globalshoes
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Istanbul for 8 daysand wanted a hotel wihin walking distance to most of the attractions. This hotel fit the bill. The lobby was very spacious and nicely decorated as was our bedroom. Bathroom a bit on the samll side but not a big deal as it was clean and the hotel facilities reflected the price we paid. I'm sure in the summer time the outside patio would have been just gorgeous but as we were there in February it was somewhat cold. Ishmael and Kadir on reception were jsut fantastic with lots of local knowledge and tips o n where to go and eat etc, The breakfast was quite good but as we were staying there for 8 days it would hav been nicce to have a change of some of the buffet items after about 4 or five days. Th downside of the resaurant was the music videos being played by the wait staff. Maybe a lot of East European guests and the urks liked them but having pop music videos being played at 8 in the morning is not what we had in mind! It was definitley a different experience and that's what we were there for and it didn't bother us tha much otherwise we would have complained. Hotel only two mins walk from a lot of great restaurants and also only about ten mins walk from Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Tram also only about 12 mins walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for clean room”
Reviews.Author: Dinnerout66
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel while walking in Sultanahmet as I needed a place for one night. Pleasant enough, very clean and good price. Window rather low, and small TV. You get a better rate if you're on your own.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: duyguakl
Reviews.Content: the best thing about the hotel is it is location .it is close to historical places and there was lots of shopping opportunuties. the staff was quite helpfull and they made us welcome straight away.the rooms were quite clean and reasonably size and i must to admit they were nicer than any other room i stayed in istanbul.and i highly recommend the view from the rooftop it is worth to see.nothing bad to say about this hotel really it was a great experience and i recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: dionysosmasamune
Reviews.Content: the experience was great mainly due to the location, the cozy place, warm lobby and warm hospitality of the staff and its knowledge of the city and the good tips (thanks Ismail, Happy Birthday again!). We'll come back and be regulars! Go FenerbaÃ§e!

Reviews.Title: “lovaly, friendly hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: regi1961
Reviews.Content: we stayed with my husband, that was very nice experience for us in istanbul.hotel is located perfect walking distance for historical places. also there is so many bars and restaurants close by to hotel but anyway hotel is very quiet location you feel like very good this Hotel ...its a real Palace. the rooms are nice and clean...Decorated as Victorian Ages in a very comfy colors...its very close to all most attractions sites and trams,....we saved a lot in the transportation expenses..the team are helpful and kind.I`ve already advised Amiral to my friends and for sure I`ll stay there again in my next visit in Istanbul. And of course I`ll spend my mornings and nigth there on great terrace. more you feel like a princess in this Hotel ...its a real Palace....I really liked the hotel... the rooms are nice and clean...Decorated as Victorian Ages in a very comfy colors...its very close to all most attractions sites and trams,....we saved a lot in the transportation expenses..the team are helpful and kind..The Manager gave us a corner room /(bigger) with nice... more you feel like a princess in this Hotel ...its a real Palace....I really liked the hotel... the rooms are nice and clean...Decorated as Victorian Ages in a very comfy colors...its very close to all most attractions sites and trams,....we saved a lot in the transportation expenses..the team are helpful and kind..The Manager gave us a corner room /(bigger) with nice view however we booked normal room...it has 2 different views, to Mosque and Aya Sofia and to the Sea...you can enjoy nice setting in the terrace with nice view....I like it so much and I recommended to all my friends...

Reviews.Title: “Just 3 Stars hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: Tatosh
Reviews.Content: I surprise to read such a great reviews for this Hotel. May be other people were lucky to be here but as for me, the Great - just location of the hotel. My room was so poor - very dark, small, uncomfortable for work at all, noisy, the walls are so thin that you can hear almost everything at the next room (especially at night) ;-) And everybody at the same floor can here you and everything inside your room... So, for my next trip to Istanbul, I'll choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great choise for istanbul”
Reviews.Author: josemore
Reviews.Content: we stayed with my fiance for new year celebrate and that was very nice experience for us in istanbul.hotel is located perfect just 5 minutes walking distance for historical places and to taxim 10 minutes by cab.also there is so many bars and restaurants close by to hotel but anyway hotel is very quiet located.when we ask something to reception always helpfull and kind and for another services like breakfast,cleaning always carefull and nice.definitelly when i go back to istanbul i can choise amiral palace.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: Norfin
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days in the Amiral Palace and enjoyed every aspect of our stay there. The outstanding features were the delightful staff, who couldn't have been more helpful and the mesmerising views of the Bosphorus from the roof terrace at dusk. Pretty much in the shadow of the Blue Mosque, the Amiral Palace is conveniently located close but not too close to the main drags of the tourist district and within easy walking distance of "Historic Istanbul". We'd heartily recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: LittleRedLaura
Reviews.Content: We had picked this hotel pretty much at random, not knowing much about Istanbul before we went and we felt very fortunate as we very much enjoyed staying at the Amiral Palace. It's well located in a reasonably quiet side street very close to a bustling main thoroughfare in Sultanhamet. We did have an initial problem with our room as the air conditioning although working was noisely dripping into a bin but on request we were swapped to a lovely, fault free room which was kept exceptionally clean, was nicely decorated and with comfortable beds. The staff were friendly and efficient and the location, c 5-10 mins walk from the Blue Mosque and nearest tram stop was both lovely & convienient. Only issue may be that the hotel is located on a fairly steep side street with a pavement which disappears half way up and is a pot holed, potentially a challenge to anyone with walking difficulties.

Reviews.Title: “you feel like a princess in this Hotel ...its a real Palace”
Reviews.Author: Alkhateeb
Reviews.Content: you feel like a princess in this Hotel ...its a real Palace....I really liked the hotel... the rooms are nice and clean...Decorated as Victorian Ages in a very comfy colors...its very close to all most attractions sites and trams,....we saved a lot in the transportation expenses..the team are helpful and kind..The Manager gave us a corner room /(bigger) with nice view however we booked normal room...it has 2 different views, to Mosque and Aya Sofia and to the Sea...you can enjoy nice setting in the terrace with nice view....I like it so much and I recommended to all my friends...

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place! Terrible people!”
Reviews.Author: stronel
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul last summer with my girlfriend and stayed just a night at Amiral. I had just the worst experience of my whole ten days trip in Turkey at this hotel. Although the place is well situated and rooms are ok, the service is very poor and people in particualr receptionists are terribly dishonest. Besides the manager is useless. One of the receptionists recommended us a terrible restaurant on the ataturk bridge. It was unpleasant and disgustingly expensive. We felt so terribly ripped off that it ruined our stay in Istanbul. When I think about it I am still upset a year after. I really advise you to avoid this awful place. If you are looking for a nice hotel in Sultanameht you should rather go to the armada hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: VivaldoSA
Reviews.Content: Exactly these words can be equal for Amiral. Any house, any hotel, any place in this world has own spirit. Amiral has "home-style" spirit. Very good receptionists, arrangement transfer from Airport to Hotel and vise versa, You can find any support and understanding from servicer and these great and helpful things in one place. I was in many places and what I can tell is that too less visited places have same atmosphere. Also for people who like to live in "heart of history" Amiral is that place where You can stay in modern age but live in old-time environment age. I`ve already advised Amiral to my friends and for sure I`ll stay there again in my next visit in Istanbul. And of course I`ll spend my mornings there on great terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored charm”
Reviews.Author: LKeck
Reviews.Content: Very nicely restored throughout, French Provincial and Turkish decor, nice helpful staff, great location, but on a narrow steep street with two way traffic in 4 directions on streets too narrow for one way. Do NOT drive yourself to this location- even the taxis can't find it and navigate the impossible traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Namiko_Mika
Reviews.Content: My parents spent 7 nights here between 8 - 15 April 2010 and they were very pleased. The hotel has a spacious nicely decorated well lit lobby, the personnel is very hospitable, helpful and nice. The rooms are big, very clean, and the bathroom is clean and well equipped with consumables. The only negative thing is that the shower is fixed on the wall, and cannot be moved. Breakfast was served in a big room and the guests had a large variety to choose from (cheese, butter, gem, omlette, boiled eggs, tea, coffee, yoghurt, milk, raisins, dry apricots, apples, oranges, juice). Even though it is a 3 star hotel, the service is beyond 3 stars. The conditions offered by this hotel and its employees overtake many 3 star hotels in Paris. The location of the hotel is right in the center, just 5 minutes away from Hagia Sofia through Arasta Bazaar. Still it is a quiet area and very safe. You can negotiate the price if you stay longer. Message for the hotel: Thank you for a pleasant and quiet stay. You were great!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel. Great location. Avoid low floors.”
Reviews.Author: ajinNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amiral Palace for a couple of nights at the end of a week in Istanbul. The location is convenient to Hagia Sofya, the Blue Mosque and most of the old part of the city. The room was clean, fairly small, but functional. The biggest issue was the noise. I was in room 208, which is located on the first floor above ground level and faces a side street. Both nights the garbage was picked up at about 2am. The first night the garbage collection lasted 15 minutes and fully woke me up. Probably smart to request a room on a higher floor and on the garden side. Although the staff was friendly, I found them somewhat unhelpful - particularly for an English speaker like me. I found the breakfast pretty bad. I would stay here again if I got a good deal and could stay in a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and superb location”
Reviews.Author: slipknotmaggot
Reviews.Content: Booked having read TA reviews. Not disappointed. Nice hotel, small but quaint rooms, clean and tidy. Cigdem went out of her way to help with sightseeing information and help with taxis. Hotel is in a great location close to Blue Mosque and other cultural sites and places of interest. Trams, and buses close by. River trips 20 minute walk. Grand bazar 20 mins. 2 minutes to some very good cafes and restaurants at good prices. Istanbul is a happening place. 30 minute taxi ride to the biggest shopping centre 4km from Taksim Sq. Would certainly come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: pussycat84
Reviews.Content: Me and my husbund stayed at Amiral for 4 days in October and it was an excelent choise.The staff was very helpfull,the room very clean ,the breakfast o.k. but nothing special.Beside the lobby there is a yard,which, every morning is prepared with blankets and pillows - a very nice place to sit .There staff braught me the every time i was sitting here. Just round the corner from the hotel you will find the very god fish restaurant"Balikci Sabahattin" Few minutes walking away,close to the Blue Mosque,you will find the Arasta Bazzar which is open aired and very nice because there are few tourist,the owner of the shops are very friendly and the goods are quality.At the end of the bazzar round the corner you will find the the the-bar with very few tourist.You can try the waterpipe or sit in the stone garden with the Blue Mosque on the right site - fantastic. I think Istanbul is amazing and will look forward to visit it again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: peebee57
Reviews.Content: This was our yearly vacation together, and my husband and I were convinced we had made the perfect choice. Istanbul and the Amiral! The hotel is situated strategically. Close to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, the Sultanahmet hub, and on a quiet street for those who want some peace in the evenings. From the terrace you have a gorgeous view of the Marmara Sea on one side, and the Blue Mosque's imposing presence on the other. It is a minutes walk to next lane, if you favour some "action"in the evening. If you aren't eating at the hotel you can grab a bite from the local Kebab vendor or eat at a pub. The rooms are well decorated,extremely clean and reasonable in size. We got the largest room and believe me it was BIG according Istanbul standards. The staff works very hard to keep everything spotless.The building doesn't look spacious from the exterior but is of a decent size. The hotel staff are hospitable, gracious and extremely helpful. Patricia, Orhan, Cidam, Imam and everybody else..........a job well done! Now, for those who complain...... English speaking people tend to forget, that the language is not necessarily spoken everywhere. Resort to sign language and a smile....you'll go a long way. At the Amiral Palace Hotel , all your complaints are dealt with speed and with a smile. There is another point we must not forget. The concept of an American breakfast in a boutique hotel is almost non existent. I heard guests asking for a toast ie a square slice of toasted bread! This is Turkey and even though they eat lots of different kinds of breads you will not find a square loaf in the local market. Amiral gets freshly baked bread every morning from the baker in the vicinity. The breakfast is adequate and my suggestion to those who want a VERY lavish spread.....stay in a five star! The Turks serve a variety of cheeses, fresh fruit and veges. Eggs are normally boiled or scrambled. Indulge in eating olives, dried apricots, juicy watermelon, raisins, yoghurt......you couldn't get healthier. We would stay at the Amiral again and yet again...........I am dreaming of my next trip already!

Reviews.Title: “It was like staying with close friends”
Reviews.Author: Shazza04
Reviews.Content: From our very first inquiry the Front Office & Sales Manager Mr. Yasin Deyirmenci's promptness, willingness to accommodate our many and varied requests and personal attention to detail, was a relief and pleasure to work with. Taking a group of senior scientists from several different countries for a meeting coordinated in a country I'd never been to would be challenging but every single member of the group of 22 people were very happy with the high standard of service, friendliness of the staff, accommodation and location and I didn't receive any complaints the entire week. The only small issue is that not all the rooms get the Wi-Fi signal so some guests had to check email in the lobby. Other staff members namely Gorhan and Iman were equally helpful and friendly. One felt you were staying with close personal friends instead of at 'just another hotel'.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: bandbcyprus
Reviews.Content: lovely small hotel close to all sights.recently refurbished. cosy rooms very clean ours was very small but the twins were bigger. staff were very helpful . not all rooms have a bath so request if you want one as most have showers and there is not tea cofee facilities as shown on some sights there is a small hill outside and a walk of 25mts will get you to a lovely street with bars and resturants . the Sultan pub was a fav and we had a lovely NYE there and Backpackers for chilling and water pipes . look on web for good deals we saved about 40% on advertised prices cant recommend our website as they have stopped doing istanbul. happy holidays

HotelInfo.Name: Amiral Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Bayramfirini Sok.No:7 | Cankurtaran, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
